data_table.description: Form 37 - Thoughts and Feelings -- social support; social integration; care giving; social strain; optimism; negative emotional expressiveness; hostility. The Thoughts and Feelings form was collected at baseline for CT and OS, and again at close-out for CT participants. Additional items were added to the form used at close-out. A close-out visit was defined as the participant's annual or semi-annual visit occurring between October 2004 and March 2005.

variable.name: F37VY
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: LISTEN
variable.description: Someone to listen when need to talk
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone you can count on to listen to you when you need to talk.

variable.name: GOODADVC
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to give you good advice about a problem

variable.name: TAKEDR
variable.description: Someone can take to the doctor
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to take you to the doctor if you need it

variable.name: GOODTIME
variable.description: Someone to have a good time with
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to have a good time with

variable.name: HLPPROB
variable.description: Someone to help understand a problem
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to help you understand a problem when you need it

variable.name: HLPCHORS
variable.description: Someone to help with daily chores
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to help with daily chores if you are sick

variable.name: SHARE
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to share your most private worries and fears

variable.name: FUN
variable.description: Someone to do something fun with
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to do something fun with

variable.name: LOVE
variable.description: Someone to love you/make you feel wanted
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? Someone to love you and make you feel wanted

variable.name: LIVALN
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live alone.

variable.name: LIVPRT
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live with my husband or partner.

variable.name: LIVCHLD
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live with my children.

variable.name: LIVSIBL
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live with my brother and/or sister.

variable.name: LIVREL
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live with other relatives.

variable.name: LIVFRNDS
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) I live with friends.

variable.name: LIVOTH
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark one oval for each item.) Other

variable.name: PET
variable.comment: Do you have a pet?

variable.name: DOG
variable.comment: What kind of pet do you have? (Mark all that apply.) Dog. Sub-question of F37 V6 Q11 'Do you have a pet'.

variable.name: CAT
variable.comment: What kind of pet do you have? (Mark all that apply.) Cat. Sub-question of F37 V6 Q11 'Do you have a pet'.

variable.name: BIRD
variable.comment: What kind of pet do you have? (Mark all that apply.) Bird. Sub-question of F37 V6 Q11 'Do you have a pet'.

variable.name: FISH
variable.comment: What kind of pet do you have? (Mark all that apply.) Fish. Sub-question of F37 V6 Q11 'Do you have a pet'.

variable.name: OTHPET
variable.comment: What kind of pet do you have? (Mark all that apply.) Other pet. Sub-question of F37 V6 Q11 'Do you have a pet'.

variable.name: RELGTIME
variable.comment: How often have you gone to a religious service or to church during the past month? (Mark only one oval.)
variable.value: Not at all in the past month
2 or 3 times in the past month

variable.name: RELSTRN
variable.comment: How much does religion give you strength and comfort? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: CLUB
variable.comment: How often have you gone to meetings of clubs, lodges, or parent groups in the last month? (Mark only one oval.)
variable.value: Not at all in the past month
2 or 3 times in the past month

variable.name: HLPSICK
variable.comment: Are you now helping at least one sick, limited, or frail family member or friend on a regular basis?

variable.name: HLPSICKT
variable.comment: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you helped this friend or family member? Sub-question of F37 V6 Q15 'Helping sick friend'.

variable.name: NERVES
variable.description: Number of people who get on nerves
variable.comment: Of the people who are important to you, how many... Get on your nerves?

variable.name: TOOMUCH
variable.description: Number of people who ask too much
variable.comment: Of the people who are important to you, how many... Ask too much of you?

variable.name: EXCLUDE
variable.description: Number of people who exclude you
variable.comment: Of the people who are important to you, how many... Do not include you?

variable.name: COERCE
variable.description: Number of people who try to coerce
variable.comment: Of the people who are important to you, how many... Try to get you to do things you don't want to?

variable.name: EXPCTBST
variable.comment: In unclear times, I usually expect the best.

variable.name: WRONG
variable.description: Expect something that can will go wrong
variable.comment: If something can go wrong for me, it will.

variable.name: HOPEFUL
variable.comment: I'm always hopeful about my future.

variable.name: NOTMYWAY
variable.description: Hardly ever expect things to go my way
variable.comment: I hardly ever expect things to go my way.

variable.name: COUNTGD
variable.description: Rarely count on good things happening
variable.comment: I rarely count on good things happening to me.

variable.name: MOREGOOD
variable.description: Expect more good things than bad
variable.comment: Overall, I expect more good things to happen to me than bad.

variable.name: KNWANGRY
variable.description: Usually people around know when angry
variable.comment: When I am angry, people around me usually know.

variable.name: TELLFEEL
variable.description: Tell from facial expressions how feeling
variable.comment: People can tell from my facial expressions how I am feeling.

variable.name: DISAPPNT
variable.comment: I always express disappointment when things don't go as I'd like them to.

variable.name: SCENEPUB
variable.description: If angered, cause scene in public place
variable.comment: If someone makes me angry in a public place, I will 'cause a scene.'

variable.name: BOTHER
variable.description: After anger bothered for a long time
variable.comment: After I express anger at someone, it bothers me for a long time.

variable.name: SUPPRESS
variable.comment: I try to suppress my anger, but I would like other people to know how I feel.

variable.name: APPRVNEG
variable.description: Fear others will not approve if negative
variable.comment: I worry that if I express negative emotions such as fear and anger, other people will not approve of me.

variable.name: ORDERS
variable.description: Take orders from someone who knew less
variable.comment: I have often had to take orders from someone who did not know as much as I did.

variable.name: BADLUCK
variable.description: Think people make bad luck for sympathy
variable.comment: I think a great many people make a lot of their bad luck in order to gain the sympathy and help of others.

variable.name: TRUTH
variable.description: Argue to convince people of truth
variable.comment: It takes a lot of argument to convince most people of the truth.

variable.name: LIE
variable.description: Most people would lie to get ahead
variable.comment: I think most people would lie to get ahead.

variable.name: HONEST
variable.description: Most people are honest due to fear
variable.comment: Most people are honest mainly through fear of being caught.

variable.name: UNFAIR
variable.description: Most people are unfair to gain profit
variable.comment: Most people will use somewhat unfair means to gain profit or an advantage rather than to lose it

variable.name: NOCARE
variable.description: No one cares what happens to you
variable.comment: No one cares much what happens to you.

variable.name: TRUSTNO
variable.comment: It is safer to trust nobody.

variable.name: FRNDSUSE
variable.description: Make friends because friends are useful
variable.comment: Most people make friends because friends are likely to be useful to them.

variable.name: NOHELP
variable.description: People inwardly don't like to help
variable.comment: Most people inwardly do not like putting themselves out to help other people.

variable.name: EXPERTS
variable.description: Experts often no better than I
variable.comment: I have often met people who were supposed to be experts who were no better than I.

variable.name: RESPECT
variable.description: People demand more respect than give
variable.comment: People often demand more respect for their own rights than they are willing to allow for others.

variable.name: BADSEX
variable.description: People guilty of bad sexual behavior
variable.comment: A large number of people are guilty of bad sexual behavior.

variable.name: LIFEQUAL
variable.comment: Overall, how you would rate your quality of life? (Mark one oval in the box below.)

variable.name: SATLIFE
variable.comment: How satisfied are you with your current quality of life? (Mark one oval in the box below.)

variable.name: WELBEING
variable.comment: How would you rate your current sense of well-being? (Mark one oval in the box below.) Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: GENHEL
variable.comment: In general, would you say your health is (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: HLTHC1Y
variable.comment: Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now? (Mark one oval.)
variable.value: Much better now than 1 year ago
Somewhat better now than 1 year ago
Somewhat worse now than 1 year ago

variable.name: VIGACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, or strenuous sports

variable.name: MODACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Moderate activities, such as moving a table, vacuuming, bowling, or golfing

variable.name: LIFTGROC
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Lifting or carrying groceries

variable.name: STAIRS
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Climbing several flights of stairs

variable.name: STAIR
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Climbing one flight of stairs

variable.name: BENDING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Bending, kneeling, stooping

variable.name: WALK1M
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking more than a mile

variable.name: WALKBLKS
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking several blocks

variable.name: WALK1BLK
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking one block

variable.name: BATHING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Bathing or dressing yourself

variable.name: INTSOC
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, to what extent has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, neighbors, friends or groups? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: BODPAIN
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much bodily pain have you had? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: PAININT
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (both outside your home and at home)? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: LESSWRKP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You cut down on the amount of time you spent on work or other activities

variable.name: LESSACCP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You accomplished less than you would have liked

variable.name: LESSKNDP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You were limited in the kind of work or other activities you did

variable.name: WRKDIFFP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You had difficulty performing work or other activities (it took extra effort)

variable.name: LESSWRKE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You cut down on the amount of time spent on work or other activities

variable.name: LESSACCE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You accomplished less than you would have liked

variable.name: LESSCARE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You did work or other things less carefully than usual.

variable.name: SICKEASY
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I seem to get sick a little easier than other people.

variable.name: HLTHYANY
variable.description: I am as healthy as anybody
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I am as healthy as anybody I know.

variable.name: HLTHWORS
variable.description: I expect health to get worse
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I expect my health to get worse.

variable.name: HLTHEXCL
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? My health is excellent.

variable.name: INTSOC2
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting with friends and relatives)?
variable.value: A little bit of the time

variable.name: FULLPEP
variable.description: Did you feel full of pep
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel full of pep?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: NERVOUS
variable.description: Have you been a very nervous person
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you been a very nervous person?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: DWNDUMPS
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: CALM
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt calm and peaceful?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: ENERGY
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you have a lot of energy?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: FELTBLUE
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt downhearted and blue?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: WORNOUT
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel worn out?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: HAPPY
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you been happy?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: TIRED
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel tired?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.name: DRESS
variable.description: Can you dress and undress self
variable.value: Unable to dress and undress self

variable.name: INOUTBED
variable.description: Can you get in and out of bed
variable.value: With some help (from a person or device)
Totally dependent to person to lift self

variable.name: SHOWER
variable.description: Can you take a bath or shower
variable.value: With some help (help in/out, tub attach)

variable.name: BLOATING
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Bloating or gas

variable.name: CONSTIP
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Constipation (difficulty having bowel movements)

variable.name: NIGHTSWT
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Night sweats

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Dizziness

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Feeling tired

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Forgetfulness

variable.name: HEARTRAC
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you... Be sure to mark one box on each line. Heart racing or skipping beats

variable.name: TREMORS
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Tremors (shakes)

variable.name: HEARTBRN
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Heartburn

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Restless or fidgety

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Low back pain

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Headaches or migraines

variable.name: CLUMSY
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Clumsiness

variable.name: TRBSEE
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Any trouble seeing that is uncorrected by lenses

variable.name: VAGITCH
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Vaginal or genital irritation or itching

variable.name: CONCEN
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Difficulty concentrating

variable.name: JNTPAIN
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you... Be sure to mark one box on each line. Joint pain or stiffness

variable.name: NOHUNGER
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Decreased appetite

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Hearing loss

variable.name: SWELLHND
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Swelling of hands or feet

variable.name: VAGDRY
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Vaginal or genital dryness

variable.name: UPSTOM
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Upset stomach or belly pain or discomfort

variable.name: URINPAIN
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Pain or burning while urinating

variable.name: COUGH
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Cough or wheezing

variable.name: VAGDIS
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms people sometimes have. For each item, mark the one oval that best describes how bothersome the symptom was during the past 4 weeks for you. Be sure to mark one oval on each line. Vaginal or genital discharge

variable.name: ANXIOUS
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Feeling nervous, anxious, on edge, or worrying a lot about different things Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: RESTLSIT
variable.description: Feeling restless so hard to sit still
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Feeling restless so that it is hard to sit still Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: TIREEASY
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Getting tired very easily Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: MSCLACHE
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Muscle tension aches or soreness Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: STAYSLP
variable.description: Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: NOCONCEN
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading a book or watching TV Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: ANNOYED
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Becoming easily annoyed or irritable Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: PANIC
variable.description: Having an anxiety attack -- feel fear or panic
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Having an anxiety attack - suddenly feeling fear or panic Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: SPOUSDIE
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner die?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: SPOUSILL
variable.description: Did your spouse have a serious illness
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner have a serious illness? Not collected on all versions of Form 37.
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: FRIENDIE
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Over the past year: Did a close friend or family member die or have a serious illness (other than your spouse or partner)?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: MONPROB
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you have any major problems with money?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you have a divorce or break-up with a spouse or partner?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a family member or close friend have a divorce or break-up?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you have a major conflict with children or grandchildren?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Pls try to think back over the past yr to remember if any of these things happened. Over the past year: Did you have any major accidents,disasters, muggings, unwanted sexual experiences, robberies or similar events?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a family member or close friend lose their job or retire?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: PETDIE
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a pet die?
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: FELTDEP
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt depressed (blue or down)
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: RESTSLP
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. Your sleep was restless
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: ENJLIF
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You enjoyed life
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: CRYSPELL
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You had crying spells
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: FELTSAD
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt sad
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: PEOPDIS
variable.comment: These are questions about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt that people disliked you
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time
Some or a little of the time
Most or all of the time

variable.name: SAD2WK
variable.comment: In the past year, have you had two weeks or more during which you felt sad, blue, or depressed, or lost pleasure in things that you usually cared about or enjoyed?

variable.name: SAD2YRS
variable.description: Felt sad two or more years
variable.comment: Have you had two years or more in your life when you felt depressed or sad on most days, even if you felt okay sometimes?

variable.name: SADMUCH
variable.description: Felt sad much of past year
variable.comment:
Have you felt depressed or sad much of the time in the past year? Sub-question of F37 V6 Q110 'Felt sad two or more years'.
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: MEDSLEEP
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you take any kind of medication or alcohol at bedtime to help you sleep?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: FALLSLP
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you fall asleep during quiet activities like reading, watching TV, or riding in a car?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: NAP
variable.description: Did you nap during the day
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you nap during the day?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: TRBSLEEP
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you have trouble falling asleep?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: WAKENGHT
variable.description: Did you wake up several times
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you wake up several times at night?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: UPEARLY
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you wake up earlier than you planned
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: BACKSLP
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you have trouble getting back to sleep after you woke up too early?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: SNORE
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you snore?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: QUALSLP
variable.comment: Overall, was your typical night's sleep during the past 4 weeks:

variable.name: HRSSLP
variable.comment: About how many hours of sleep did you get on a typical night during the past 4 weeks?

variable.name: INCONT
variable.comment: Have you ever leaked even a very small amount of urine involuntarily and you couldn't control it?

variable.name: FRQINCON
variable.comment:
How often does this leaking urine occur? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.
variable.value: One or more times a week

variable.name: NOINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) No longer leak urine Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: CGHINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I cough, laugh, sneeze, lift, stand up. Or exercise Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: TOINCON
variable.description: Leak when can't get to toilet
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I feel the need to urinate and can't get to a toilet fast enough Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: SLPINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I sleep Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: OTHINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Other Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: LEAKAMT
variable.description: How much urine do you lose
variable.comment:
How much urine do you usually lose when it leaks? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: NOPRTCT
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) None Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: MINIPAD
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Mini-pad, tissue or towel Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: MENSPAD
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Menstrual pad or shield Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: DIAPER
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Diaper, towel, Attends, Depends Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: OTHPRTCT
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Other Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: INCONLMT
variable.comment:
How often does the leakage of urine limit your daily activities? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: INCONDIS
variable.comment:
How much does the leakage of urine bother or disturb you? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F37 V6 Q121 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F37 V6 Q123 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 37.

variable.name: MARRIED
variable.comment: Are you currently married or in an intimate relationship with at least one person?

variable.name: SEXACTIV
variable.comment: Did you have any sexual activity with a partner in the last year?

variable.name: SATSEX
variable.comment: How satisfied are you with your current sexual activities, either with a partner or alone? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: SATFRQSX
variable.comment: Are you satisfied with the frequency of your sexual activity, or would you like to have sex more or less often? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: SEXWORRY
variable.comment: Are you worried that sexual activities will affect your health?

variable.name: ACTDLY
variable.comment: Computed from Forms 36/37, questions 85-88. Source: WHI BAC. Four items describing basic activities (whether can eat, dress, get in and out of bed, and take a bath) each of which has three possible values (1=without help, 2=some help, 3=completely unable) are summed. A lower score indicates greater ability to cope with daily living activities. Missing if any of the four items are missing.

variable.name: AMBEMOT
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 30, 31 and 32. Reference: King L, Emmons R (1990). Average of three components coded from 1=strongly disagree to 5=strongly agree. The summary score ranges from 1 to 5 where a higher score indicates greater ambivalence in expressing negative emotions. Missing if any of the three components is missing.

variable.name: CAREGIV1
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, question 15. Source: Cardiovascular Health Study. CAREGIV1 is an indicator of whether the participant is currently helping a sick, limited or frail family member on a regular basis. (See also CAREGIV2.)

variable.name: CAREGIV2
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, question 15 and 15.1. Source: Cardiovascular Health Study. CAREGIV2 combines questions 15 and 15.1 to give the number of times per week a participant currently helps a friend or family member. (See also CAREGIV1. )

variable.name: EMOLIMIT
variable.description: Role Limitations Due to Emotional Problems
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 68, 69, and 70. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on role limitations due to emotional problems. EMOLIMIT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: EMOWELL
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 77, 78, 79, 81, and 83. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on emotional well-being. EMOWELL ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: ENERFAT
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 76, 80, 82, and 84. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on energy/fatigue. ENERFAT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: HOSTIL
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 33-45. Source: Cynicism Subscale of Cooke-Medley Questionnaire. Sum of thirteen True/False items resulting in a possible range from 0 to 13 where a higher score indicates greater hostility. Missing if any of the thirteen items are missing.

variable.name: GENHLTH
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 49, 71, 72, 73, and 74. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on general health. GENHLTH ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: LFEVENT1
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 91, and 93-102. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. The eleven items are recoded, setting original responses from 1-3 equal to 1, and then summed. The construct has a range from 0 to 11 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events. Missing if any of the eleven items are missing.

variable.name: LFEVENT2
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, question questions 91, and 93-102. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. This construct is a sum of the eleven items that are coded from 0-3 resulting in a range from 0 to 33 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events. If any of the eleven items are missing, LFEVENT2 is set to missing.

variable.name: LIVALOR
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 10.1-10.7. Indicator of whether the participant lives alone.

variable.name: NEGEMOT
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 26-29. Reference: King L, Emmons R (1990). Average of four components coded from 1=strongly disagree to 5=strongly agree. The summary score ranges from 1 to 5 where a higher score indicates greater ambivalence in expressing negative emotions. Missing if any of the four components is missing.

variable.name: OPTIMISM
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 20-25. Source: Life Orientation Test-Revised (LOT-R). Sum of six components coded from 1=strongly disagree to 5=strongly agree. Questions 21, 23 and 24 are reverse coded before summing. The summary score ranges from 6 to 30 where a higher score indicates greater optimisim. Missing if any of the six components is missing.

variable.name: PAIN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 62 and 63. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on pain. PAIN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PHYLIMIT
variable.description: Role Limitations Due to Physical Health
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 64-67. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on role limitations due to physical health. PHYLIMIT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PHYSFUN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 51-60. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on physical functioning. PHYSFUN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PSHTDEP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 103-108, 109, and 110. Source: Center for Epidemiological Studies; depression scale (CES-D, short form). PSHTDEP ranges from 0 to 1 with a higher score indicating a greater likelihood of depression. Cutoff values of .06 and .009 have been used to indicate depression.

variable.name: SLPDSTRB
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 114-117 and 119. Sum of five components. Questions 114-117 range from 1-5 and are recoded to a 0-4 scale. Question 119 is recoded and reverse coded resulting in a range from 0-4 before summing. The summary score ranges from 0 to 20 where a higher score indicates greater sleep disturbance. Missing if any of the five components is missing.

variable.name: SOCFUNC
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 61 and 75. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on social functioning. SOCFUNC ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: SOCSTRN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 16-19. Source: Antonucci TA, Kahn RC, Akiyama H (1989). Scale measuring negative aspects of social relations. Sum of four components coded from 1=none to 5=all. The summary score ranges from 4 to 20 where a higher score indicates more social strain. Missing if any of the four components is missing.

variable.name: SOCSUPP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 1-9. Source: Medical Outcomes Study. Sum of nine components coded from 1=none of the time to 5=all of the time. The summary score ranges from 9 to 45 where a higher score indicates more social support. Missing if any of the nine components is missing.

variable.name: SYMPTOM
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/37, questions 89.1-89.34. Source: PEPI, national and other surveys. Average of 34 items measuring occurrence and severity of symptoms. The summary score ranges from 0 to 3 where a higher score indicates more numerous and/or more severe symptoms. Missing if any of the 34 items is missing.
